title: Service D1 Disk I/O Bottleneck Causing Partial Request Failures

symptoms.user_facing: 33% of requests through B path experiencing 5-10 second delays
monitoring_alerts: Service D1 disk I/O wait time > 80%
Uneven load distribution across D instances

root_cause.primary: Service D1 disk I/O bottleneck caused by large log files not being rotated
root_cause.secondary: Log4j configuration missing rotation policy, causing single 15GB log file

analysis_steps: 1. Monitoring shows 33% of B->D requests are slow
2. Check load balancer - traffic evenly distributed to D1, D2, D3
3. D2 and D3 respond normally, D1 shows high response times
4. D1 system metrics show 85% disk I/O wait time
6. Log rotation configuration was overridden in last deployment
7. Single large file causing read/write contention
resolution: Implemented emergency log rotation, fixed Log4j configuration, redistributed load during maintenance
lessons_learned: Log rotation policies must be validated in deployment pipeline
Disk I/O monitoring alerts needed for all service instances
